title: Thomas Dennerby
text:
Thomas Dennerby (born 13 August 1959 in <a href="Enskede-%C3%85rsta-Vant%C3%B6r">Enskede</a>) is a Swedish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach.
Career.
Dennerby, the former coach of the Nigeria women's national football team also known as super Falcons was previously a player in <a href="Hammarby%20IF">Hammarby IF</a> and Spårvägens IF, as well as the national U21 team. He has also worked as a police officer. As a coach, he won <a href="Allsvenskan">Allsvenskan</a> with Hammarby IF in 2001, and <a href="Damallsvenskan">Damallsvenskan</a> with <a href="Djurg%C3%A5rdens%20IF%20Fotboll%20%28women%29">Djurgården/Älvsjö</a>.
Dennerby can be seen in the <a href="Sveriges%20Television">Sveriges Television</a> documentary television series "<a href="The%20Other%20Sport">The Other Sport</a>" from 2013.
He became manager of <a href="Nigeria%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">the Nigerian women's national team</a> in January 2018. He resigned in October 2019.
On 9 November 2019, <a href="All%20India%20Football%20Federation">All India Football Federation</a> (AIFF) appointed Dennerby as the head coach of <a href="India%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">India U17 Women's team</a> which is going to participate in the <a href="2020%20FIFA%20U-17%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2020 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup</a> as the host of the edition.
Later Thomas Dennerby took charge as Head Coach of the Indian Senior Women’s National Team in August, 2021.
